dataImport.title: Data Import
dataImport.subtitle: Import data from old Bixa PHP system to ZNode
dataImport.uploadDesc: Upload the SQL dump file from your old Bixa PHP system (bixa.sql)
dataImport.importNoteDesc: This will import users, hosting accounts, tickets, SSL certificates and settings from the old system. Builder and base settings will be skipped.
dataImport.dropZone: Click or drag SQL file here
dataImport.previewDesc: Review the data found in the SQL file before importing
dataImport.adminConflictDesc: Admin emails that match current admin will be skipped: {emails}
dataImport.configureDesc: Configure how data should be imported
dataImport.passwordModeDesc: Old passwords cannot be reused. Choose how to set new passwords for imported users.
dataImport.randomPasswordDesc: Generate a unique random password for each user
dataImport.uniformPasswordDesc: Set the same password for all imported users
dataImport.importSettingsDesc: Import MOFH, SMTP, and domain settings from old system
dataImport.sendEmailsDesc: Send each user an email with their new login credentials
dataImport.noEmailWarning: Users will not receive their new passwords. You will need to notify them manually or use the password reset feature.
dataImport.confirmDesc: This action will import all data from the old system. This cannot be undone. Are you sure?
dataImport.importingDesc: Please wait while data is being imported. Do not close this page.
dataImport.doneDesc: Data has been successfully imported from the old system
dataImport.popupDesc: We detected this is a fresh installation. Would you like to import data from your old Bixa PHP system?

ssl.title: SSL Certificates
ssl.subtitle: Manage SSL certificates for
ssl.manageDesc: Manage SSL certificates for all your hosting accounts
ssl.cloudflareConfigDesc: Configure Cloudflare API for DNS-01 challenges on subdomain SSL
ssl.apiTokenDesc: Create a token with Zone:DNS:Edit permission in Cloudflare Dashboard
ssl.intermediateDomainDesc: Domain used for CNAME delegation in DNS-01 challenges
ssl.domainSettingsDesc: Configure service domains and ACME settings
ssl.serviceDomainsFromAllowed: Service domains are automatically loaded from Allowed Domains settings
ssl.noServiceDomains: No domains configured. Add domains in Settings > Allowed Domains.
ssl.acmeEmailDesc: Email for ACME account registration and certificate expiry notifications
ssl.useStagingDesc: (for testing, does not issue real certificates)
ssl.googleConfigDesc: Configure Google Cloud Service Account for automatic EAB key generation. This is the recommended method.
ssl.serviceAccountJsonDesc: Paste the entire JSON content from your Service Account key file. EAB keys will be generated automatically.
ssl.manualEabDesc: If you prefer to manually generate EAB keys using gcloud CLI, enter them here. Note: Each key can only be used once.
ssl.allCertificatesDesc: View and manage all SSL certificate requests
ssl.noCertificatesDesc: You haven't requested any SSL certificates yet. Click the button above to request one.
ssl.noCertificatesForHosting: No SSL certificates for this hosting account
ssl.noHostingDesc: You need to create a hosting account first before requesting SSL certificates.
ssl.requestDesc: Request a free SSL certificate for your domain
ssl.howItWorksDesc: Request a certificate, add the DNS record shown, click verify. Once verified, your certificate will be issued automatically.
ssl.addCnameRecord: Add the following CNAME record to your DNS:
ssl.addTxtRecord: Add the following TXT record to your DNS:
ssl.autoVerifyingDesc: DNS record has been automatically created. Verification in progress...
ssl.dnsCreatedDesc: The DNS verification record has been automatically added. Please wait for DNS propagation and verification.
ssl.verifyingDnsDesc: DNS verification in progress. Please wait...
ssl.verifyingDesc: We are checking your DNS record. This may take a few moments. If the DNS record was just added, please wait for DNS propagation (can take up to 48 hours).
ssl.issuingDesc: Your certificate is being issued. This usually takes a few minutes.
ssl.privateKeyWarning: Never share your private key with anyone. Keep it secure.
ssl.hostingRequiredDesc: This subdomain requires a hosting account.
ssl.noSlotDesc: You have reached your hosting account limit.
ssl.noActiveHostingDesc: You need at least one active hosting account to request SSL for a custom domain.
ssl.cpanelApprovalDesc: You must login to cPanel at least once before requesting SSL certificates.
ssl.processingDesc: Your SSL certificate is being issued automatically. This may take 1-2 minutes.
ssl.readyToIssue: Your domain has been verified. You can now issue the SSL certificate.
ssl.clickIssue: Click the button below to start the certificate issuance process. This may take a few minutes.
ssl.issuingInProgress: The ACME server is processing your certificate request. Do not close this page.
ssl.autoInstalledDesc: This SSL certificate has been automatically installed on your hosting account. No manual action required.

settings.generalSettingsDesc: Configure your website name, logo, and other general settings
settings.siteIdentityDesc: Configure your website name and slogan
settings.siteNameHint: This will appear in the browser title and header
settings.siteSloganHint: A short description of your website
settings.invalidImageType: Please select a valid image file
settings.emailVerificationDesc: Configure whether users need to verify their email after registration
settings.enableEmailVerificationDesc: When enabled, new users must verify their email address before accessing all features.
settings.turnstileDesc: Configure Turnstile captcha for email verification and form protection
settings.enableTurnstileDesc: Require captcha verification for email verification
settings.turnstileSiteKeyHint: Get this from Cloudflare Dashboard > Turnstile
settings.turnstileSecretKeyHint: Keep this secret. Used for server-side verification.
settings.turnstileServicesDesc: Select which services require captcha verification
settings.turnstileCreateHostingDesc: When users create new hosting accounts
settings.turnstileCreateSSLDesc: When users request new SSL certificates
settings.turnstileCreateTicketDesc: When users create new support tickets
settings.turnstileReplyTicketDesc: When users reply to support tickets
settings.maintenanceModeDesc: Enable maintenance mode to temporarily disable the site
settings.enableMaintenanceDesc: When enabled, users will see a maintenance message instead of the site.
settings.maintenanceMessageHint: This message will be displayed to users during maintenance
settings.maintenanceWarningDesc: Make sure to add your IP address to the allowed list before enabling maintenance mode, otherwise you may lock yourself out.
settings.maintenanceAllowedIPsHint: Comma-separated list of IPs (IPv4 or IPv6) that can bypass maintenance mode. Example: 192.168.1.1, 2001:db8::1
settings.imgbbIntegrationDesc: Configure ImgBB for image paste upload in the text editor. Users can paste screenshots (Ctrl+V) and they will be automatically uploaded.
settings.imgbbStep1: Users take a screenshot or copy an image
settings.imgbbStep2: Paste into the text editor with Ctrl+V
settings.imgbbStep3: Image is automatically uploaded to ImgBB and embedded
settings.seoDesc: Configure meta tags, robots.txt, and sitemap for search engines
settings.seoMetaTagsDesc: Each language has its own SEO meta tags. When users switch language, meta tags update automatically.
settings.seoPageTitleHint: Recommended: 50-60 characters. Shown in browser tab and search results.
settings.seoDescriptionHint: Recommended: 150-160 characters. Shown below title in search results.
settings.seoKeywordsHint: Comma-separated keywords. Used by some search engines.
settings.seoCustomHeadTagsHint: HTML tags injected into <head>. Use for analytics, verification, structured data, etc.
settings.seoCanonicalDesc: The primary URL of your site. Used for canonical links and hreflang tags.
settings.seoCanonicalHint: Leave empty to auto-detect. Include https:// without trailing slash.
settings.seoRobotsDesc: Control how search engines crawl your site. Use {{SITE_URL}} as placeholder for your site URL.
settings.seoSitemapDesc: Auto-generated sitemap with all public pages, KB articles, and hreflang links.
settings.seoEnableSitemapDesc: Generate /sitemap.xml automatically with all pages and KB articles
settings.seoSitemapCustomUrlsHint: One URL per line. Format: /path|priority|changefreq. Static pages and KB articles are included automatically.

maintenance.title: Under Maintenance
maintenance.defaultMessage: We are currently performing scheduled maintenance. Please check back soon.

backup.title: Backup & Restore
backup.createFirstBackup: Create your first backup to see it here
backup.retentionHelp: Automatic backups older than this will be deleted
backup.restoreDescription: Select a completed backup to restore your data
backup.createBackupFirst: Create a backup first before you can restore
backup.restoreWarning: Restoring will overwrite current data. Make sure you have a recent backup before proceeding.
backup.restoreConfirmMessage: This action will overwrite all current data with data from this backup. This cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?
backup.deleteConfigConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this configuration?
backup.deleteBackupConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this backup?
backup.leaveEmptyToKeep: Leave empty to keep existing password
backup.googleDriveNotConnected: Connect your Google account to backup to Google Drive
backup.selectFolder: Select a folder or leave empty for root
backup.folderIdPlaceholder: Folder ID (optional, will use root if empty)
backup.googleFolderHelp: Leave empty to save backups in your Google Drive root folder
backup.autoFolderNote: Backups will be saved in "zbackup" folder automatically
backup.restoreNewServerDesc: If you just set up a new server and need to restore from an existing backup, connect your storage first.
backup.newServerTip: Connect to your Google Drive or FTP/SFTP to access backups from your previous server. After restore, you will be logged out automatically to avoid conflicts.
backup.connectStorageFirst: Connect to a storage (Google Drive or FTP) to see available backups

setup.restoreSubtitle: Upload a backup file to restore data on this new server
setup.uploadBackupDesc: Upload a backup file to restore your data on this new server
setup.step1: Go to your Google Drive and find the "zbackup" folder
setup.step2: Download the backup file (.zip) you want to restore
setup.step3: Upload the file below to restore your database
setup.selectBackupFile: Select a .zip backup file from your computer
setup.uploadWarning: This will import the database from the backup file. After restore, you can login with the credentials from the backup.
setup.clickToUpload: Click to select a backup file
setup.invalidFileDesc: Please select a .zip, .sql.gz or .sql backup file
setup.adminExists: An admin account already exists. Please login normally.

install.welcomeDesc: Set up your free hosting platform in just a few steps.
install.freshInstallDesc: Set up a new ZNode platform from scratch with default data and create your admin account.
install.restoreFromBackupDesc: Migrate from another server by restoring a backup file. Your settings, users, and data will be preserved.
install.dbTestRefused: Connection refused. Check host and port.
install.dbTestHostNotFound: Host not found. Check your database host address.
install.dbTestAuthFailed: Authentication failed. Check username and password.
install.dbTestDbNotFound: Database '{name}' does not exist. Create it first.
install.dbTestTimeout: Connection timed out. Check if the database server is reachable.
install.dbTestUnreachable: Cannot reach database server. Check if it is running.
install.createAdminDesc: Set up your administrator account to manage the platform.
install.siteSettingsDesc: Customize your platform name and details. You can change these later.
install.doNotClose: Please do not close this page.
install.restoreBackupDesc: Upload a backup file to restore your data from another server.
install.restoreWarning: This will import all data from the backup file including users, settings, and content. After restore, login with credentials from the backup.
install.installCompleteDesc: Your platform is ready. Login with your admin credentials to get started.
install.restoreCompleteDesc: Your data has been restored. Login with your credentials from the backup.
install.restartNote: The server has been automatically restarted. You can now login.

support2fa.title: 2FA Support
support2fa.subtitle: Can't access your authenticator app? Submit a support ticket and we'll help you regain access.
support2fa.verifyNote: For security, our team may ask you to verify your identity before disabling 2FA on your account.
support2fa.subject: Subject
support2fa.subjectPlaceholder: e.g., Lost access to authenticator app
support2fa.messagePlaceholder: Describe your situation. Why can't you access your authenticator app?
support2fa.ticketCreatedDesc: Your support ticket has been submitted. Our team will review your request and help you regain access to your account.
support2fa.activeTicket: You have an active support ticket
support2fa.sessionExpired: Your session has expired. Please login again to continue.

forum.title: Community Forum
forum.subtitle: Ask questions, share knowledge, and connect with others
forum.noPostsDesc: Be the first to start a discussion!
forum.noCommentsDesc: Be the first to share your thoughts!
forum.postLocked: This post is locked. No new comments allowed.
forum.deletePostDesc: This will permanently delete the post and all its comments.
forum.titlePlaceholder: What do you want to discuss?
forum.contentPlaceholder: Share your thoughts, questions, or ideas...
forum.author: Author
forum.name: Name
forum.deleteChannelDesc: This will delete the channel and all its posts.
